title: PTD Today — Media
disclaimer: Informational only — AI-generated summaries; may contain errors. Verify with the original video.

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Daniel Tom, 31, owns and operates Bay Area Sanitation, managing a fleet of almost 2,000 portable toilets that service construction sites and events across the San Francisco Bay Area. The company reported $4.3 million in total income in 2025.
bullets: Owner/operator: Daniel Tom, 31, runs Bay Area Sanitation.
Service area: construction sites and events in the San Francisco Bay Area.
Video: CNBC Make It profile (production credits listed).
takeaways: A ~2,000-unit fleet and $4.3M revenue indicate a sizable, established regional sanitation operator.
Such companies can be reliable partners for temporary on-site sanitation during data center construction or maintenance.
Regional focus in the Bay Area suggests quick local responsiveness for projects in that geography.
Contracting with established local service providers can streamline logistics for site builds and events.

items.title: Zip Up, Clip In, Copilot On

ai.summary: Based on the available description, the video shows Jo discovering the power of Copilot Groups to make route planning easy. It highlights Copilot and AI as tools that simplify planning workflows.
bullets: Route planning is presented as made easy.
Jo discovers the capabilities of Copilot Groups.
Emphasis on the power of Copilot in planning scenarios.
takeaways: If Copilot Groups streamline route planning, operational planning time for field teams may be reduced.
Simpler route planning could improve coordination for maintenance and service tasks in grid/data center environments.
Adopting Copilot Groups may support integrating AI into routine operational workflows.
Decision-makers should consider evaluating Copilot Groups for route and dispatch planning use cases.

items.title: Audyt w erze AI: praktyczne zastosowania i realne korzyści | Katarzyna Chojniak, Alicja Barska

ai.summary: Based on the available description… KPMG podcast episode explains that AI is already integrated into audit work, helping with repetitive tasks, large-scale data analysis and decision-making. Hosts Katarzyna Chojniak and Alicja Barska describe practical tools (AI Transaction Scoring Tool, Clara AI, KPMG Clara/Clara for Clients), the move from sampling to full-population analysis, impacts on auditor roles and competencies, plus implementation, security and regulatory challenges.
bullets: AI supports repetitive tasks, analysis of full populations and improved decision-making for audits.
Highlighted tools: AI Transaction Scoring Tool; Clara AI (conversational assistant and specialised agents).
KPMG Clara platform enables real-time audit management; Clara for Clients modernises client communication.
Shift from sampling to full-population analysis changes auditor roles and required competencies.
Discussion covers implementation challenges, data security, regulatory environment and potential AI risks.
takeaways: Audits will increasingly use full-population data—ensure datasets are complete and accessible to enable efficient AI-driven analysis.
Prioritise data security and regulatory compliance as audits process larger volumes of sensitive data with AI tools.
Prepare teams for AI-enabled workflows by developing the technical and analytical competencies auditors now need.
Consider platforms (e.g., KPMG Clara / Clara for Clients) that support real-time audit management and streamlined client interaction.

items.title: Arknights: Endfield | 4K NVIDIA DLSS 4 Launch Trailer

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Arknights: Endfield has officially launched and features NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation. The game is a 3D real-time strategy RPG where you play the Endministrator exploring Talos-II; the trailer footage was captured on a GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra settings using DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
bullets: Arknights: Endfield launch announced, highlighting NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation.
Genre: 3D real-time strategy RPG; player role is the Endministrator on Talos-II.
Trailer captured on GeForce RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra, DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode.
Description links to NVIDIA DLSS 4 article and the game's official site for more details.
Social channels for the game and NVIDIA GeForce are listed (X, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, Twitch).
takeaways: DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation is being adopted in commercial titles — validate DLSS4 SDK/driver support on your GPU fleet.
Trailer capture used an RTX 5080 at 4K Ultra — consider RTX 50-series class GPUs when planning for high-resolution render/capture workloads.
DLSS 4 Multi Frame Generation 4X Mode suggests tradeoffs between native rendering and upscaling — perform performance/quality tests on target hardware.
Use the provided NVIDIA DLSS 4 article and the official Arknights: Endfield site to obtain technical details and test assets for benchmarking and procurement.
